headline: Is It Time To Reassess Equinix (EQIX) After Shares Reach About US$848?
summary: If you are wondering whether Equinix is genuinely good value at around US$848.12 per share, you are not alone. Many investors are asking whether the current price fairly reflects the quality of the business. The stock has seen mixed returns, with gains of 3.3% over the last 7 days, 6.0% over the last 30 days and 11.0% year to date, set against a 7.0% decline over the last year and longer term returns of 23.7% over 3 years and 31.6% over 5 years. Recent coverage of Equinix has focused on its...

headline: From Silicon To Steel: The Value Trade Returns
summary: US markets diverged as soft labor data fueled a 4% small-cap rally while Nasdaq fell 2% on AI doubts and mixed REIT earnings trends. Check out why value wins.

headline: The Bull Case For Equinix (EQIX) Could Change Following Its 2026 Earnings Setup Amid AI Data Center Focus
summary: In recent days, Equinix has drawn attention as investors focus on its upcoming February 11, 2026 earnings release and evolving analyst views amid broader REIT market developments. An interesting angle is how Equinix sits at the center of enduring enthusiasm for data center REITs, as AI-driven computing demand keeps this niche in focus even while other AI-linked trades see reduced interest. We’ll now examine how Equinix’s role in the AI-fueled data center REIT theme shapes its investment...

headline: Equinix Draws Steady Interest As AI Infrastructure Demand Supports Data Centers
summary: Data center REITs, including NasdaqGS:EQIX, are attracting sustained investor interest as money moves away from broader AI trades. The sector is seeing ongoing demand from compute intensive customers that rely on large scale digital infrastructure. This shift highlights how AI focused workloads are supporting data center usage even as enthusiasm cools for some AI linked stocks. Equinix, listed as NasdaqGS:EQIX, operates interconnected data centers that support cloud and AI workloads for a...
